page.title: 05BAKERY IN DUNSCROFT
page.content: TEESDALES IS A SMALL BAKERY IN DUNSCROFT NEAR HATFIELD.IT IS SITUATED BETWEEN A ROW OF SHOPS ALONG ABBEY ROAD.IT IS A FAMILY SHOP AND HAS REGULAR CUSTOMERS.THE OWNER IS A MIDDLE AGED WOMAN CALLED MRS ATKINSON.SHE LIVES ON A FARM WHERE THE FRUIT IS GROWN FOR THE PIES.SHE EMPLOYS TWO WOMEN TO WORK IN THE SHOP. THE BAKEHOUSE IS IN ASKERN. THEY SELL A NUMBER OF THINGS BESIDES CAKES AND BREAD.FOR EXAMPLE 'POP',CRISPS,BISCUITS,ETC.THE BEST DAY IS SATURDAY AND THE TAKINGS ARE ABOUT Â£700 TO Â£800 ON AN AVERAGE WEEK. THE BEST SELLING THING IN THE SHOP ARE THE BREAD ROLLS WHICH ARE COMMONLY KNOWN AS 'BURGER ROLLS".
